Reviews.Title: Great except for the noisy fan
Reviews.Author: BriBones
Reviews.Content: May 5 Update: Dell Support was very helpful with a quick solution to upgrade the BIOS on the laptop. One that was complete, it became a nice quiet laptop that fully meets my hardware needs. Windows 8, however, I still do not like, but that is not what I'm reviewing here.Original post:I like everything about this laptop (not counting Windows 8 which, so far, I do not like) except for its fan noise. It's quiet for a little bit when I first boot it, but once it warms up the fan comes on and is annoyingly loud. Once on I have not yet had the fan slow back down into quietness. I haven't yet decided if this is annoying enough to return it. I'll decide that this weekend. All of my previous laptops were quieter than this one. I'm leaning toward a non-Dell but don't know which might be better and quieter.

Reviews.Title: Very good system for the price
Reviews.Author: Mearrf
Reviews.Content: I was replacing my older Dell with this one. I was very pleased and it was exactly what i was looking for. If you are not familiar with Windows 8, it will take some getting used to. I would buy this again hands down.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Freak
Reviews.Content: So far I love my Dell laptop and I  don't have any problems with it yet, the features it has as well as the how big the screen is.

Reviews.Title: Great for general use
Reviews.Author: Felipe Venturim
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent laptop for everyday use and, despite being a 17', it's light for its size, making it confortable to carry around. Never tried any games on it, so I can't talk much about graphics and all, but everything else works like a charm. Only thing though, sometimes it's kinda slow, probably because its 5400 RPM hard drive.

Reviews.Title: Did not work right out of box
Reviews.Author: Landon Crigler
Reviews.Content: I opened the box followed instructions and turned on the power switch and all I got was a series of beeps. I called the number on the box for service. I gave all my information so as not to have to give it again and I was transferred. Then I gave my information and was transferred again. After having the agent repeat herself after each statement I had to do the same. I have a southern accent and she had another. After about and hour she said it was the mother board and I would have a box to return it in two days. I said I bought a new computer and that is what I want, not a repaired computer. She checked with the manager and he said they would do that. It would take 10 to 13 business days. I can get a computer box in two days and a box with a computer takes 10 to 13 business days. I said ok. I will finish my review in 10 to 13 business days.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: WolfQueen13
Reviews.Content: After having a home computer for over 6 years the old computer finally needed replacing, & I decided to go the way of a laptop for a new one. For what I was looking for this one matched what I wanted for the price I could afford. So far I couldn't be happier. I had to get used to Windows 8, but it didn't take long to figure out how it works. I actually really like it because you can go between the "Start" page & a regular desktop screen. The "start" page is customizable so you can put all your favorite programs on one page without having to navigate through other stuff to get the program/s you want to use.I do not use my laptop for anything fancy: regular internet stuff such as checking e-mails, hanging out on a few forums & my favorite websites, Netflix (hence why I bought a laptop with such a large screen), editing my business website, search engines when necessary, etc. Once you get used to everything its very easy to navigate including settings. Im not very techy so I cant give a fancy review about RAM & RPM, but for what its worth the computer runs smoothly, quickly, & I haven't had any issues so far. This computer starts up & is functional VERY quickly: it doesnt take more than a minute or 2 to start up from when you hit the power button to typing in your log in password & getting to the "start" page.The touch pad took getting used to as well, & like any laptop it makes scrolling a little difficult & slow, but I bought a wireless mouse for when I need to do stuff with extra speed. The screen is bright (when you set it to be), & all pictures/images are clear & crisp.A full battery lasts a little over 6 hours at full screen brightness (which is a big battery killer), & charging a dead battery takes no more than 2 hours. This laptop comes with a battery monitor so it tells you percentage & how much longer your battery should last as well as battery health (so you know when the battery needs replacing), & there are settings you can change if you plan to keep the laptop plugged in for extended periods of time, plan on frequently charging it with a not low battery (ex: 50%, 75%, etc), etc.Shipping wise it was packed well & arrived on time.The only con is the size of the laptop can be be a bit bulky, but I think its worth it so its not a huge deal for me.Overall VERY happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Desktop Replacement
Reviews.Author: R. Bernard
Reviews.Content: SPECS:OS: Windows8 64bitCPU: Intel Core I5-4200 @ 1.60GHzMemory: 8GB installed, supports 16GBVideo: Intel(R) HD Graphics Family with 2GB of memoryScreen: 17" touch screenGood:1. Aluminum body is beautiful, looks awesome when closed.2. Light up keyboard with number pad3. Access to all major components (Battery, HDD, memory, optical drive) See below4. Decent video capabilities. I have the laptop connected to a 20" external monitor (DVI to HDMI adapter required) and use the notebook as a second monitor with no problems. I was able to RCT3 on steam with no issue, which is about as extreme as I normally go!5. Nice wide feet. The laptops feet go all the way across the laptop.6. Touch screen. I tried it out briefly and it works as expected. I'm not sure how much I'll use it but it's a nice to have.7. Nice big touch pad that supports gestures.8. Included dell software lets battery charge float instead of remaining at 100% constantly which can reduce battery life.Bad:1. Battery access compartment is hard to access without scratching the finish. Be very careful and don't rush or you will scratch it guaranteed; don't ask how I know this! If you do go in, try to do all your upgrades at once to minimize the chances of scratching the case. Of course now that I think about it a suction cup would probably make this a breeze.2. Network jack has a fold down door because of the low side profile. It seems fairly sturdy but, I can't say how it will hold up in the long run so be mindful when plugging in a network cable.Indifferent:1. My laptop came with a WD blue 750GB HDD which was decent. I swapped in a 256 Samsung Pro SSD I had on hand and the speed difference is awesome; boot times were no more than 10 seconds and that is being conservative.See note above about accessing the battery compartment if you go this route. Once the door was off the swap out was easy. Disable secure boot in the BIOS before you clone the existing HDD or it won't work (Samsung data migration software). I haven't re enabled it but, I might try later and see if it works.2. Windows 8. I wish it came with the pro version but I can upgrade that later3. The screen, I have yet to find a laptop monitor the looks as good as a desktop and this is no different. It still is acceptable.Overall:Great laptop for a person who is ready to let go of the desktop permanently.  I do wish it had an option for a full fledged docking station but, at this price point (879 as equipped that's asking a bit much)

Reviews.Title: Disappointed...
Reviews.Author: L. Lilly
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this laptop and give it 5 stars but I can't. I bought it a week ago and put 16GB memory and a 7200rpm 1TB drive in it. Wow, it's fast and I love it.....when it's working.  I solved the random freezing and shutting down problem and the noisy fan problem by downloading the latest BIOS on Dell's website.  Ok, great.  But now I'm unhappy again because the Wi-Fi works randomly...it works for about 5 minutes, and then drops the connection.  So I have to reboot to get the Wi-Fi working again and the connection back until it drops again.  If I leave my computer for a little while and come back, the Wi-Fi will be disconnected - it's very annoying to have to reboot all the time for this problem.  So I went to Dell's site and downloaded the latest Wi-Fi drivers and installed them.  It helped a little bit and keeps the connection a little longer now, but it's still dropping my connection after 20-60 minutes, even when I'm in the middle of something - it's very annoying.  My sister's old Lenovo, my cell phone, my brother's Acer, and others have no problem keeping connected to the same various Wi-Fi routers as we're traveling, but this laptop's Wi-Fi has a problem.  I can't deal with this problem as I travel a lot and need Wi-Fi reliability.  My 3 year old Dell laptop was great but unfortunately I gave it to a friend and don't have it anymore...I was hoping this one would be as reliable.  It looks like I will have to RMA it and buy something else.  Now I'm here at my friend's house two states away from where I live, and it's dropping me again. Ok, I'm done with this laptop, will find and buy another one and RMA this one. It's getting frustrating now. Sorry Dell or Intel, if you can fix the Wi-Fi issues, then I would love this laptop.*Update - Yes i know about the Intel Centrino Wireless Adapter issues and I've addressed the cause and solutions given by Intel but to no avail.  Still randomly disconnecting.  Here what Intel says about the issue -CauseAn adapter internal error related to power management has occurred. This problem only occurs when some level of adapter power savings mode is enabled.WorkaroundA workaround for the affected releases is to disable all adapter power savings modes. You can do this by  selecting the lowest power management setting, which enables the maximum wireless network performance.Intel also says that the latest driver software fixes the problem - well it didn't fix mine.**Update again - I have the proposed fix for the Intel Centrino Wireless Adapter problem -Here they are:  In the Intel Centrino Wireless-N 2230 Adapter Advanced settings, make the following changes and the wireless disconnection problems hopefully will be eliminated.802.11n Mode = ENABLEDAd Hoc Channel 802.11b/g = 11Bluetooth(R) AMP = DISABLEDMixed Mode Protection = RTS/CTS EnabledRoaming Agressiveness = 5.HIGHESTSleep on WoWLAN Disconnect = DISABLEDTransmit Power = 5.HIGHESTWake on Magic Packet = DISABLEDWake on Pattern Match = DISABLEDWireless Mode = 3. 802.11b/gI hope these settings fix my wi-fi problems.  So with the current BIOS, latest drivers, and these settings, maybe there won't be anymore problems?  I hope I don't have to RMA this laptop because I want to love it. I will give it a few days to determine if everything is fixed now or not.

Reviews.Title: A beautifully designed work machine that gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Femi Olawuyi
Reviews.Content: I love my new laptop, it replaced my old one a dell inspiron 1525. The 17" screen size, resolution and speed makes my work flow easy and fast. Windows 8 is good but driver/compatibility issues with some of my older gadgets and softwares can sometimes be frustrating. Overall, it is cute for it's size and gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: I prefer dell
Reviews.Author: horse20
Reviews.Content: Solid laptop I like it a lot. Only draw back WINDOWS 8 wish it was 7 but I'll make do.

Reviews.Title: This is my first personal laptop. Everything looks good.
Reviews.Author: Vaitheeswaran
Reviews.Content: Battery comes only for 3 hours. Other than that everything looks good. I like this Laptop very much. Windows 8 looks good.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Coburn
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this laptop! It has a beautiful display, runs multiple programs and is fast. It is very impressive and I would recommend this laptop to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: really nice one !
Reviews.Author: Pushaka S W Qubro
Reviews.Content: It have nice display capability and compatibility, good for everyday use also because I use it like 7-10 hours non stop.Even when I use it for gaming which is 3 - 5 hours it still ok.However the fan is pretty noisy that I choose to buy cooler to support it.That is why I choose Dell,they are really produce credible pc and laptop.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: Wilfredo Sánchez
Reviews.Content: simply spectacular, excellent product, silienciosa, excellent battery life, screen Aplia magnificent to play pretty fast and pleased with window 8

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: Ayodeji
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice laptop fast to boot at startup, easy to use, does not make noise when in use, clear display and graphics. However its windows 8 needs mastering, may be a little strange and difficult at first but once you follow the user instructions it gets easier. Like any other new model computer it needs updating and purchasing of software like antivirus etc. in terms of speed I don't have much stuff on it yet so its fast although I must say I expected a 2.7 GHz processor but got a 1.8GHz. Apart from that it works really well. Good work Dell.

Reviews.Title: Letters rub off on Keyboard
Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this product. I have NEVER had a computer where the letters on th keyboard wore off. I have not even had this computer for a year , and this is unacceptable!!!!

Reviews.Title: Quality goods and services
Reviews.Author: Anna Maria Toppin
Reviews.Content: When i got my laptop i was very surprise how little time it took to get to my courier.  The laptop finish is really, really nice and i works like a dream.Thank you seller, i will purchase again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Dell Inspiron 17 review of purchase
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: There was no manual with the laptop.  Not knowing anything about Windows 8 made it hard to get started and find everything within the computer.  I dislike that the fan seems to run all the time while I am using the machine and the mouse seems to go crazy every now and then when being used.  I have purchased a wireless mouse which helps.  Otherwise, the size of the monitor is great.  Overall I like the model.

Reviews.Title: performance not good
Reviews.Author: sunil kumar k
Reviews.Content: performance of the laptop was not good. processor was too slow.pc gets hanged so many times a day.looks like the pc is not a new one and instead it is refurbished one.

Reviews.Title: Very nice Laptop
Reviews.Author: Bill's Fan
Reviews.Content: Like the laptop, have to learn windows 8.  Met all my expectations.  Would reccomend this laptop as a good choice for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Vineeth Mathew
Reviews.Content: I liked the product and purchased this for my brother. I heard he is happy with the laptop. Good one.

Reviews.Title: Nice machine
Reviews.Author: Edin
Reviews.Content: Nice laptop, battery life decent, speed ok, plays most of the games despite intel graphic card. Wifi adapter amazing. Nice big screen. I dont believe you can  get anything better for this money. ADVICE" Add some more money and buy Corei7 or laptop with nvidia GPU.

Reviews.Title: Not that impressed
Reviews.Author: jennifer cashin
Reviews.Content: The computer works fine however it is SUPER SUPER noisy. It is constantly hissing and gets warm fast. Otherwise it is fine- nothing great.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Brian Walker
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for myself in preparation of starting online college. There were a few issues with the default settings for the laptop that were a little irritating. For example, the wireless connection would drop out randomly. Come to find out that it was set to disconnect if power use gets too high. It is a setting that is easily changed but why would they make that the default? Kind of silly. Also, the automatic updating which updated and then restarted my computer randomly was irritating until I figured out how to change that setting. Aside from these strange default settings, I have to give the laptop five stars because it has performed admirably in every other task that I have needed it for. It is quick, has plenty of memory, large screen, and decent sound. If you are looking for a large laptop at an affordable price for average use, this laptop is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Wish I never bought it
Reviews.Author: deodric
Reviews.Content: The laptop they sent was an i3 processor, had disfunctional keys, and only 3gb  and now my gf is pretty disappointed that the laptop i got for her was a piece of garbage

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: AnnDi
Reviews.Content: I have been using this laptop on the daily basis for about 5 months now and couldn't be happier with this purchase. It's fast, battery life is good,  silent and not heavy at all. I am a online student and this laptop is perfect for all my needs.

Reviews.Title: dell inspiron 17 inch laptop
Reviews.Author: amazon addict
Reviews.Content: I purchased this one in September to replace one that went completely crazy and couldn't be fixed. its big. and heavy. you wont be taking it all over with you. the color is very good. sound is ok. the battery life sucks. you might get 4 hours when it is new but now im lucky to get 21/2 hours. it is fast except for loading some things, for instance I use aol and like to read the news things on huff news, takes for ever to load and all the videos go start and stop. very annoying. I get all the updates and think it should be just seamless but it is not.I don't use the windows 8 side at all. I even got the book, missing manuel and it still is hard to use. I just use the internet explorer side and it works well. I only do aol. google and email so I haven't stressed it all. don't know about games or movies, other videos .or music.the case is good and doesn't reflect fingerprints at all. overall I like it because it is better than the dell I had before but still doesn't do like I think a computer should do. and im just a novice and cant help but wonder what a real computer operator would think about it.

Reviews.Title: the item is a faulty one.
Reviews.Author: Sambaran Saha
Reviews.Content: the item is a faulty one. i just got a new replacement from dell but the first one is just a dead box fro me

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 is a flop, expect to spend $150 at crucial on memory before turning this on.
Reviews.Author: Business Actualization
Reviews.Content: Not usable until you upgrade all drivers, the OS to windows 8.1 and buy the max possible memory at crucial.

Reviews.Title: that's very good
Reviews.Author: Ruifeng
Reviews.Content: that's really very good, it is a perfect laptop that I love it.Dell Inspiron 17 i17RM is a very good choose if your old laptop is broken.

Reviews.Title: great product, great seller, best price
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Jimenez
Reviews.Content: really happy with this machine, great for my work, really fast core i5, bigest screen. low weight for a machine of 17"

Reviews.Title: Ups and downs of this laptop
Reviews.Author: J. Lee "imajeel"
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased this one from Amazon, I replaced my desktop computer with a very similar Dell Inspiron that I purchased off of Craigslist from someone that found it was just too big and heavy to be lugging around as a laptop.  I killed that one by accidentally spilling a bottle of PowerAde all over it (PowerAde doesn't give more power to computers :-))  So, obviously I like the computer, since I've purchased it twice.  Here's the ups and downs from this one that I purchased on Amazon.LOVE/STILL LOVE:- Big screen, with clear picture- Full Keyboard with numbers pad- Great space-saving alternative to a desktop- Good audioNOT SO GOOD:- I miss my old one - this one came with Windows 8, which I absolutely hate. Not intuitive, everything is automatically linked to make MSN and Bing your main portals (email, search, people, news, etc. buttons --- all going to their sites.  Looked for a way to change it - but couldn't find one.  It's just a pain, and I don't know why Dell let Microsoft's desires win out over customer ease of use.- I generally always hate setting up a computer with the software I use, apps and bookmarks all over again... (thus, buying them from people that have already loaded them with MS Office, etc.)  The lack of easy user interface on this one, made that process even more painful.- It's big. It's heavy. To me, it really is, for the most part my home computer.  Easy enough to move around the house, and occasionally take on a road trip - but, I wouldn't ever plan on using this as my regular "carting it around the world" on a regular basis laptop.BOTTOM LINE: Great computer with all the features, speed and a nice big screen for movie watching that make it worth the cost, brought down by Dell putting Windows 8 on it and making the user interface so difficult to use.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: Kurt Koehler "Kurt"
Reviews.Content: bought this laptop last week. Day one of use, the laptop shut down no less than 6 times. Second day of use, last night, lap top shut down 4 times, ususally after 15-20 min of use.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: MauiPackNShip
Reviews.Content: Had 2 months..Computer blacks out and cannot get screen back unless I unplug, take out battery and restart....Support was useless..wants me to pay for service contract. NEVER BUY DELL AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: Promptly delivered but shockingly new!
Reviews.Author: R. H. Page "golden oldie"
Reviews.Content: This Dell Windows 8 Laptop was delivered promptly and it did do what I bought it to do, namely, play all the DVD-RW's I couldn't play on my old Windows laptop.  But I went into traumatic shock when I tried doing my favorite routines on the new Windows 8. It was like being transplanted to a Martian landscape!  What a huge disappointment!  After much Googling, I was finally able to mimic the best of the old on the shockingly new.  So I guess it's OK.  It's certainly much faster and has a lot more memory!  My next challenge will be finding some way to maneuver around all the new high-speed advertising that's taken over the internet!

Reviews.Title: at least it wasn't pink
Reviews.Author: soca shopper "tropical truths"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my cousin and so far she is like it ( she is an adult). We were happy with the colour and the speed of delivery. With regard to operation- so far good enough.

Reviews.Title: Not user friendly and sound is extremely low and poor quality.
Reviews.Author: P. Emory
Reviews.Content: First the sound is only audible when it is turn up to 100 % and it is of poor quality.  Windows 8 is extremely hard to use, even with the tour.  I can't find anything on it.  I looked for Applications to get the calculator, applications does not exist on windows 8. The quality of the screen isn't there either.  I had a Dell Inspiron 17 7010 series, which was less expensive than this and loved it.  I am so sorry I purchased this laptop.  I can't use it for anything but to check email and read the news.  Don't waste your money on a windows 8 pc.

ProductInfo.Features:
3rd Generation Intel Core i5-3337U Processor (3M Cache, up to 2.7 GHz)
6 GB DDR3 RAM
750 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
17.3-Inch Screen
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: Dell Inspiron 17 i17RM-2419sLV 17.3-Inch Laptop (Moon Silver)
